page.title: List of monasteries dissolved by Henry VIII of England

revision.comment: [[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Izzypic1999241099|Izzypic1999241099]] ([[User talk:Izzypic1999241099|talk]]) to last version by ImageRemovalBot
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=October 2008}} These [[monastery|monasteries]] were dissolved by [[King Henry VIII of England]] in the [[Dissolution of the Monasteries]]. The list is by no means exhaustive, since over 800 religious houses existed before the Reformation, and virtually every town, of any size, had at least one abbey, priory, convent or friary in it. (Often many small houses of monks, nuns, canons or friars.) {{incompletelist|date=February 2011}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! class="unsortable" | Image ! Name ! Location ! Order !
